title: Small cars banned, only sedans allowed for airport pickups: App-based taxi services say
byline: App-based taxi services at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) claimed that they are facing huge issues after airport authorities suddenly decided to limit the types of vehicles allowed inside the airport.

title: Shortage of critical drugs leaves thousands in quandary
byline: Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of several medicines, including cancer drugs, insulin, and oral rehydration salts like Jeevani affecting both government hospitals and pharmacies.

title: Credit card spend picks up in April by Rs.4.4bn
byline: There has been some modest pickup in credit card spend in April reflecting that consumers are ramping up spending on everything from their staples to discretionary such as dine-outs and recreational activities as conditions turn relatively better while prices ease and the interest rates decline.

title: Ravi slams Government’s mixed signals on renewable energy
byline: A heated debate broke out in Parliament yesterday (17) as UNP MP Ravi Karunanayake criticised the government’s handling of the country’s renewable energy policy and power sector management.

title: Trump to extend US TikTok ban deadline, White House says
byline: TikTok will live on for at least another three months in the United States, as President Donald Trump is poised to extend a sale or ban deadline for the third time since taking office this year.

title: Australia lifts blood, plasma donation ban for gay men
byline: Rules that effectively banned all sexually active gay and bisexual men from donating blood and plasma are being lifted in Australia.

title: Tilvin seeks furthering of ties with Communist Party of China
byline: JVP General Secretary Tilvin Silva who is now in China at the invitation of the Communist Party of China (CPC) met with the Minister of the International Department of the CPC Central Committee, Liu Jianchao and other officials.

title: Speaker approves emergency debate on Iran–Israel conflict
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne has granted approval for an emergency debate on the ongoing Iran–Israel conflict, scheduled to take place at 3:30 p.m. today.

title: Many flights to Indonesia’s Bali cancelled after volcano eruption
byline: Several flights to the Indonesian resort island of Bali were cancelled and the airport in Maumere in East Nusa Tenggara province was closed due to the eruption of Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Inmates stage rooftop protest at Boossa Prison
byline: A group of inmates at Boossa Prison climbed onto the facility’s roof this morning (18) in protest against intensified search operations being conducted within the prison premises.

title: ICFS to host Study Abroad Open Day in Colombo on June 21
byline: Students seeking to pursue higher education abroad will have a valuable opportunity to take the next step in their academic journey at the ICFS Study Abroad Open Day, scheduled for Saturday, 21 June 2025, at the Courtyard by Marriott, Colombo.

title: Vraie Cally Balthazaar assumes duties as Colombo’s 26th mayor
byline: Vraie Cally Balthazaar of the National People’s Power (NPP) officially assumed duties today as the 26th Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Patients charged up to Rs. 250,000 for hospital-supplied item worth Rs. 17,500 - Bribery Commission
byline: Patients were forced to pay between Rs. 120,000 and Rs. 250,000 for a medical item labelled EVD, used in surgeries at a government hospital in 2022 that had been officially procured and supplied to a government hospital at just Rs. 17,500 (its current market value being around Rs. 46,500), the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) revealed yesterday.

title: Over 20 injured in bus-lorry collision in Eheliyagoda
byline: A total of 23 people were injured following a head-on collision between a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus and a lorry at Minnana Junction in Eheliyagoda this morning.

title: Two arrested over Rs. 10 Mn ransom demand
byline: Two suspects were arrested by the Negombo Divisional Criminal Investigation Bureau for demanding a ransom of Rs. 10 million and extorting Rs. 2 million from the victim.

title: Trump to extend US TikTok ban deadline, White House says
byline: TikTok will live on for at least another three months in the United States, as President Donald Trump is poised to extend a sale or ban deadline for the third time since taking office this year.
